SLIDE_TEXT:
Mathematically, shift invariance means that if the input shifts by some amount—say a—the output shifts by the same amount. The system’s operation stays consistent, no matter where or when the input occurs.
Shift invariance, combined with linearity, gives us powerful tools for analyzing systems. Together, they allow us to model and predict system behavior with confidence, whether in medical imaging, signal processing, or other fields of engineering.
